member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.PlanSetup.SetCalculationOption(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Sets the given calculation option to the given value. Before setting the options for the model, set the calculation model. See SetCalculationModel.
member.param: The name of the calculation model.

The XPath or name of the option to set. If this is not an XPath, the method sets the first attribute that matches the name. Example 1: CalculationGridSizeInCM in the Anisotropic Analytical Algorithm (AAA) sets the option /AAACalculationOptions/@CalculationGridSizeInCM. Example 2: MaximalDrillDepthInCM in the Proton Convolution Superposition (PCS) algorithm sets the option /ProtonCalculationOptions/ScatteringUniformScanning/CompensatorConversion/Drilling1/@MaximalDrillDepthInCM. To set the values, for example, for the Drilling2 settings, you have to specify the entire XPath /ProtonCalculationOptions/ScatteringUniformScanning/CompensatorConversion/Drilling2/@MaximalDrillDepthInCM.
The value to set.
member.returns: Returns false if the method cannot find the given option.
member.remarks: Available options are stored in the schema files of the calculation model located on the Distributed Calculation Framework (DCF) server.

member.summary: [Requires a research license] Enables write-access to the data model from the Scripting API if the system is configured for research use. member.remarks: The method CanModifyData can be used to check if the system allows write-access to the data model.

member.name: T:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.OptimizationEUDObjective
member.summary:
A gEUD objective is an exact, upper or lower objective. An exact gEUD objective defines an exact dose value that a target structure should receive. An upper gEUD objective defines the maximum dose value that a structure should receive. A lower gEUD objective defines the minimum dose value that a target structure should receive.
Generalized Equivalent Uniform Dose (gEUD) is a uniform dose that, if delivered over the same number of fractions, yields the same radiobiological effect as the non-uniform dose distribution of interest.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ExternalPlanSetup.RemoveTemporaryPlan
member.summary: This method is used to remove the temporary copy of the original IPlanSetup object that was created for intermediate dose calculation. The method should be called only after the optimization is done, otherwise the intermediate dose is disposed too early. The temporary copy should be removed because it is copy of an existing plan and this might cause problems when saving other plans to database, e.g., in automated validation tests. The plan is removed in the same way as in the optimization client for Eclipse.

For example, the X-axis for MLCX and the Y-axis for MLCY. The two-dimensional array is indexed [bank, leaf], where the bank is either 0 or 1. member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ExternalPlanSetup.CreateEvaluationDose
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Creates an evaluation dose for the plan. The voxels in an evaluation dose can be set using the Eclipse Scripting API instead of a dose calculation algorithm. To create an evaluation dose, the plan must not contain any beams. To set the evaluation dose voxels, retrieve the dose matrix using the DoseAsEvaluationDose property of the plan and then use SetVoxels.
member.returns: A new evaluation dose object.
member.remarks: Saving modifications to the database is not possible if the evaluation dose has been created but voxels have not been set.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ExternalPlanSetup.DoseAsEvaluationDose

member.name: T:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.BeamParameters
member.summary: [Requires a research license] An editable copy of the parameters of a treatment beam.
member.remarks: To apply the parameters, call the ApplyParameters method of the Beam class. Because the parameters are simple copies, they do not reflect the current state of the data model.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.BeamParameters.SetAllLeafPositions(System.Single[0:,0:])
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Assigns the given leaf positions to each of the control point parameters.
member.param: The positions of the MLC leaf pairs (in millimeters) in the IEC BEAMLIMITING DEVICE coordinate axis appropriate to the MLC device type: the X-axis for MLCX and the Y-axis for MLCY. The two-dimensional array is indexed [bank, leaf], where the bank is either 0 or 1. Bank 0 represents the leaf bank to the negative MLC X direction, and bank 1 to the positive MLC X direction.
member.remarks: To apply the parameters, call the ApplyParameters method of the Beam class.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.BeamParameters.SetJawPositions(VMS.TPS.Common.Model.Types.VRect{System.Double})
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Assigns the given jaw positions to each of the control point parameters.
member.param: A rectangle describing the jaw positions in millimeters in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinates.
member.remarks: To apply the parameters, call the ApplyParameters method of the Beam class.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.BeamParameters.ControlPoints
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Editable control point parameters copied from the treatment beam.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.BeamParameters.GantryDirection
member.summary: [Requires a research license] The direction of gantry rotation (clockwise or counterclockwise).

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.BeamParameters.Isocenter
member.summary: [Requires a research license] A copy of the isocenter position, in millimeters.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.BeamParameters.WeightFactor
member.summary: [Requires a research license] The weight factor of the beam.
member.remarks: The total dose distribution of a plan is calculated by adding the individual beam dose distributions. Before doing this, the dose distributions of each beam are multiplied with the respective beam weights, which indicate the relative weight of each beam in a plan. How the weight factors affect the dose distribution is determined by the selected beam normalization method.

member.summary: [Requires a research license] The volumetric representation of a structure. This object is used when defining margins for structures, or when performing Boolean operations on structures.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Converts an object into its XML representation. For more information on how to serialize an object into an XML document, see .
member.param: The System.Xml.XmlWriter stream, to which the object is serialized.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume.And(VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume)
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Creates a combination of segment volumes. The existing segment volumes are not modified. The combination includes the areas that belong to both this segment volume and another segment volume, that is, the intersection of this and the other segment volume.
member.param: The segment volume that is combined with this segment volume.
member.returns: A new combined segment volume.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume.AsymmetricMargin(VMS.TPS.Common.Model.Types.AxisAlignedMargins)
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Expands or shrinks this segment volume with the specified margins, aligned to the axes of the image coordinate system.
member.param: The margins in millimeters. The maximum is 50.
member.returns: A new expanded or shrunk segment volume.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume.Margin(System.Double)
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Creates a new segment volume by expanding or shrinking this segment volume with the specified margin (in millimeters). A positive value creates an outer margin. A negative value creates an inner margin.
member.param: The used margin in millimeters. The maximum is 50.
member.returns: A new expanded or shrunk segment volume.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume.Not
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Creates a combination of segment volumes. Does not modify this segment volume. The combination includes the area that covers everything else but this segment volume.
member.returns: A new combined segment volume.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume.Or(VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume)
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Creates a combination of segment volumes. The existing segment volumes are not modified. The combination includes the areas that belong to this segment volume, to another segment volume, or both, that is, the union of this and the other segment volume.
member.param: The segment volume that is combined with this volume.
member.returns: A new combined segment volume.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume.Sub(VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume)
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Creates a combination of segment volumes. The existing segment volumes are not modified. The combination includes the area that belongs to this segment volume, but not to the other segment volume.
member.param: The segment volume that is subtracted from this segment volume.
member.returns: A new combined segment volume.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume.Xor(VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SegmentVolume)
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Creates a combination of segment volumes. The existing segment volumes are not modified. The combination includes the areas that belong either to this segment volume or to another segment volume, but not to both of them.
member.param: The segment volume that is combined with this volume.
member.returns: A new combined segment volume.

member.name: T:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint
member.summary: Represents a point in a planned sequence of treatment beam parameters. See the definition of control points in a DICOM RT Beam.
member.remarks: Control points are discussed in DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.14. All beams have at least two control points. Note that some values may be NaN if they are not applicable to the treatment plan in question.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Converts an object into its XML representation. For more information on how to serialize an object into an XML document, see .
member.param: The System.Xml.XmlWriter stream, to which the object is serialized.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.CollimatorAngle
member.summary: The orientation of the IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system with respect to the IEC GANTRY coordinate system (in degrees).
member.remarks: The definition is adapted from DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.14 "Beam Limiting Device Angle", but rotation direction is not specified explicitly.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.GantryAngle
member.summary: The gantry angle of the radiation source. In other words, the orientation of the IEC GANTRY coordinate system with respect to the IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (in degrees).
member.remarks: The definition is from DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.14 "Gantry Angle", but rotation direction does not change during treatment and it is specified in Beam.GantryDirection instead.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.JawPositions
member.summary: The positions of the beam collimator jaws (in mm) in the IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinates.
member.remarks: The definition is adapted from DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.14 "Leaf/Jaw Positions". The difference is that DICOM likens the collimator jaw positions with MLC leaf positions and places them in the same sequence.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.LeafPositions
member.summary: The positions of the beam collimator leaf pairs (in mm) in the IEC BEAMLIMITING DEVICE coordinate axis appropriate to the device type. For example, the X-axis for MLCX and the Y-axis for MLCY. The two-dimensional array is indexed [bank, leaf] where the bank is either 0 or 1. Bank 0 represents the leaf bank to the negative MLC X direction, and bank 1 to the positive MLC X direction. If there is no MLC, a (0,0)-length array is returned.
member.remarks: The definition is adapted from DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.14 "Leaf/Jaw Positions". The difference is that DICOM supports a position sequence for each collimator type while we support a position sequence for a single MLC plus four jaws.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.MetersetWeight
member.summary: The cumulative meterset weight to this control point. The cumulative meterset weight for the first item in a control point sequence is zero.
member.remarks: The meterset at a given control point is equal to the beam meterset, multiplied by the cumulative meterset weight for the control point, divided by the final cumulative meterset weight. The definition is adapted from DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.14.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.PatientSupportAngle
member.summary: The patient support angle. In other words, the orientation of the IEC PATIENT SUPPORT (turntable) coordinate system with respect to the IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (in degrees).
member.remarks: The definition is from DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.14 "Patient Support Angle", but here rotation direction is specified implicitly towards the shortest angle between the current and the next control point.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.TableTopLateralPosition
member.summary: Table top lateral position in millimeters, in the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.TableTopLongitudinalPosition
member.summary: Table top longitudinal position in millimeters, in the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPoint.TableTopVerticalPosition
member.summary: Table top vertical position in millimeters, in the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system.

member.name: M:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.OptimizationSetup.AddNormalTissueObjective(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Adds a new normal tissue objective (NTO) or updates the data of the existing objective. Only one NTO can be added. Calling this function disables the automatic NTO if it has been set previously.
member.param: Determines the relative importance of the normal tissue objective in relation to other optimization objectives.The value is positive.
Determines the distance in millimeters from the target border where the evaluation of the normal tissue objective dose begins.
Determines the relative dose level in the normal tissue objective at the target border, expressed in percentage of the upper objective for the target. The value is positive. 100% is specified as 100.
Determines the relative dose level in the normal tissue objective in the area furthest from the target border. Expressed in percentage. The value is positive. 100% is specified as 100.
Determines the steepness of the normal tissue objective fall-off. The value is positive.
member.returns: The added parameter.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.SourcePosition.Transform
member.summary: The 4x4 transformation matrix represents the orientation and location of the source position in space. The matrix is composed of a 4x3 rotation submatrix and a 4x1 translation vector. Its bottom row indicates scaling and is always [0 0 0 1]. The translation vector indicates the coordinates of the source position center, in millimeters. The third column of the rotation matrix indicates the source axis direction.

member.summary: Defines whether source decay is accounted for in treatment planning. If the value is true, the dose calculation uses the source at its calibration activity (nominal activity). If the value is false, the source strength is decayed to the treatment activity based on the treatment date of the plan where the source is used.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.OptimizationNormalTissueParameter.DistanceFromTargetBorderInMM
member.summary: Determines the distance in millimeters from the target border where the evaluation of the normal tissue objective dose begins.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.OptimizationNormalTissueParameter.EndDosePercentage
member.summary: Determines the relative dose level in the normal tissue objective in the area furthest from the target border. Expressed in percentage. The value is positive. 100% is specified as 100.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.OptimizationNormalTissueParameter.FallOff
member.summary: Determines the steepness of the normal tissue objective fall-off. The value is positive.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.OptimizationNormalTissueParameter.IsAutomatic
member.summary:
Returns True if an automatic normal tissue objective (NTO) is used. The automatic NTO adapts to the patient anatomy and the optimization objectives, and automatically determines the dose fall-off criteria.
When an automatic NTO is used, the other properties of this object, except Priority, are not used.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.OptimizationNormalTissueParameter.Priority
member.summary: Determines the relative importance of the normal tissue objective in relation to other optimization objectives. The value is positive.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.OptimizationNormalTissueParameter.StartDosePercentage
member.summary: Determines the relative dose level in the normal tissue objective at the target border, expressed in percentage of the upper objective for the target. The value is positive. 100% is specified as 100.

member.name: T:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters
member.summary: [Requires a research license] An editable copy of the parameters of a control point.
member.remarks: To apply the parameters, call the ApplyParameters method of the Beam class. Because the parameters are simple copies, they do not reflect the current state of the data model.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters.CollimatorAngle
member.summary: [Requires a research license] A copy of the collimator angle at this control point, in degrees, in the range [0, 360[. It is defined as the orientation of the IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system with respect to the IEC GANTRY coordinate system (in degrees).
member.remarks: This property cannot be edited directly. Consider if removing and creating a new Beam works for your use case.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters.GantryAngle
member.summary: [Requires a research license] A copy of the gantry angle at this control point, in degrees, in the range [0, 360[. It is defined as the orientation of the IEC GANTRY coordinate system with respect to the IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (in degrees).
member.remarks: This property cannot be edited directly. Consider if removing and creating a new Beam works for your use case.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters.JawPositions
member.summary: [Requires a research license] A copy of the jaw positions of the treatment beams at this control point in millimeters, and in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinates.
member.remarks: To set the same leaf positions for all control points (as is required if you use a static beam), use the SetJawPositions method in BeamParameters.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters.LeafPositions
member.summary: [Requires a research license] A copy of the positions of the MLC leaf pairs (in millimeters) in the IEC BEAMLIMITING DEVICE coordinate axis appropriate to the MLC device type: the X-axis for MLCX and the Y-axis for MLCY. The two-dimensional array is indexed [bank, leaf], where the bank is either 0 or 1. Bank 0 represents the leaf bank to the negative MLC X direction, and bank 1 to the positive MLC X direction. If no MLC exists, a (0,0)-length array is returned.
member.remarks: To set the same leaf positions for all control points (as is required if you use a static MLC), use the SetAllLeafPositions method in BeamParameters.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters.MetersetWeight
member.summary: [Requires a research license] A copy of the cumulative meterset weight to this control point.
member.remarks: This property cannot be edited directly. Consider if removing and creating a new Beam works for your use case.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters.PatientSupportAngle
member.summary: [Requires a research license] A copy of the patient support angle at this control point, in degrees, in the range [0, 360[. It is defined as the orientation of the IEC PATIENT SUPPORT (turntable) coordinate system with respect to the IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (in degrees).
member.remarks: This property cannot be edited directly. Consider if removing and creating a new Beam works for your use case.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters.TableTopLateralPosition
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Table top lateral position in millimeters, in the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters.TableTopLongitudinalPosition
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Table top longitudinal position in millimeters, in the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system.

member.name: P:VMS.TPS.Common.Model.API.ControlPointParameters.TableTopVerticalPosition
member.summary: [Requires a research license] Table top vertical position in millimeters, in the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system.
